abstract.text: Retrieves the user’s current Sign in with Apple authorization credentials.

inlineContent.text: A string that contains a random value for verifying the Sign in with Apple credentials.
A string that contains a random value for verifying the Sign in with Apple credentials.
A closure that takes a parameter for the user’s current Sign in with Apple credentials, and an error if one occurs while retrieving them.
Calling this method causes the system to present the Sign in with Apple upgrade interface, dismissing any currently presented interface.

abstract.text: Make it easy for users to log into apps and services.
An object that you interact with to change an account’s password or to upgrade to Sign in with Apple.
Cancels a request with an error.
Completes a request to update an account’s authentication credentials from using a weak password to using a strong password.
Completes the process of upgrading an account’s authentication credentials from using passwords to using Sign in with Apple.
Retrieves the user’s current Sign in with Apple authorization credentials.
A credential that results from a successful Apple ID authentication.
A key that specifies a string value to show to the user when a request fails.
Automatically and transparently convert accounts to Sign in with Apple or to use strong passwords for improved security.

doc://com.apple.authenticationservices/d.title: Upgrading Account Security With an Account Authentication Modification Extension

abstract.text: Securely authenticate users and create accounts for them in your app.

doc://com.apple.documentation/documentat.title: Authenticating users with Sign in with Apple

abstract.text: Information about an error condition including a domain, a domain-specific error code, and application-specific information.
A static, plain-text Unicode string object which you use when you need reference semantics or other Foundation-specific behavior.
A Unicode string value that is a collection of characters.
The return type of functions that don’t explicitly specify a return type, that is, an empty tuple `()`.
A type representing an error value that can be thrown.

https://developer.apple.com/videos/play/.title: Get the most out of Sign in with Apple
